summary: This bill, the 'Washington, D.C. Admission Act,' proposes admitting the residential areas of Washington, D.C. as the 51st state, named 'Washington, Douglass Commonwealth.' It would grant the new state two Senators and one Representative in Congress. The bill outlines the procedure for this admission, including the initial elections. It redefines the national capital as a smaller, non-residential federal district encompassing key government buildings like the White House and Capitol. The legislation provides a detailed transitional framework for the courts, federal employees, and government agencies, and includes a provision to facilitate the repeal of the 23rd Amendment.
